posts.post_content:
Rhys shows how they needed to balance the [Wellwisher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wellwisher). Life gain equal to the number of elves can build up very fast. His toughness is a little low to survive many attacks to try to pump him with things like [Imperious Perfect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Imperious Perfect) or [Bramblewood Paragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bramblewood Paragon).  
  
*Regarding the legend rule: As long as they aren't the same card you can have both in play. If you have an Odyssey [Kamahl, Pit Fighter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Pit Fighter ) in play and cast a 10th edition [Kamahl, Pit Fighter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Pit Fighter) , the legend rule will send both to the graveyard. If you had any [Kamahl, Pit Fighter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Pit Fighter) in play and cast [Kamahl, Fist of Krosa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Fist of Krosa), the legend rule sees them as different legends and both stay in play.*
posts.html:
Rhys shows how they needed to balance the Wellwisher. Life gain equal to the number of elves can build up very fast. His toughness is a little low to survive many attacks to try to pump him with things like Imperious Perfect or Bramblewood Paragon.

Regarding the legend rule: As long as they aren't the same card you can have both in play. If you have an Odyssey Kamahl, Pit Fighter in play and cast a 10th edition Kamahl, Pit Fighter , the legend rule will send both to the graveyard. If you had any Kamahl, Pit Fighter in play and cast Kamahl, Fist of Krosa, the legend rule sees them as different legends and both stay in play.
Report Abuse

posts.post_content: Yep, the legend rule only cares if they have the entire name exactly the same. The planeswalker rule, however, cares if their planeswalker type is the same. If both Rhys cards were planeswalkers instead they would probably both have the type Rhys and could not be in play at the same time.
posts.html:
Yep, the legend rule only cares if they have the entire name exactly the same. The planeswalker rule, however, cares if their planeswalker type is the same. If both Rhys cards were planeswalkers instead they would probably both have the type Rhys and could not be in play at the same time.
